main event: Various persons reported seeing an unidentified aircraft over St. John's, Newfoundland on 30 July 1950.
interesting points: Witnesses described the object as bright and blue, with a few stating it looked like a meteor., One observer believed it discharged a stream of flame and could strike the ground near Pepperrell AFB., Lt. Col. from Pepperrell AFB reported the object moving southward and thought it was the most beautiful meteor he had ever seen., Different accounts reported the object moving at varying speeds and heights, creating confusion about its actual nature., The investigation involved collaboration between RCAF Newfoundland and USAF.
witness description: residents and military personnel near Pepperrell Air Force Base
